title: Login and Verify Error message
custom_preconds:
Logins: 
BOC:
club-boc-intl/club-boc-intl
admin-ops-intl/admin-ops-intl
Club:
club-nyy-intl/club-nyy-intl
club-ari-intl/club-ari-intl

Log in with BOC account
custom_steps:
1. Load Ebis test environment and log in as BOC
2. Locate Create New widget
3. Select International Amateur Player from Dropdown
4. Click Next
custom_expected:
1. Home dashboard displays to user 
2. Create new widget is located on home dashboard 
3. Create New Widget displays International Fields
4. Error message displays that required fields must be filled in.

title: Verify that they are not subject to L1 Registration
custom_steps:
1. On Create New widget select International Amateur Player from Dropdown
2. Fill in all required fields
3. Enter a DOB BEFORE 9/1/1995
4. Click 'Next'
custom_expected:
1. International Fields display
2. Fields work as expected 
3. Message appears on top of Year field saying "Not Subject to L1 Reg" and Hidden Profile Checkbox appears for BOC login only
4. Intl Player profile is displayed in edit mode. Data from Create New widget is populated into the profile. L1 Registered Status says "Grandfathered"

title: Verify Grandfathered players are created successfully
custom_steps:
1. With profile still in edit mode, fill in all required fields and attach a file with any label.
2. Click Save to submit player
custom_expected:
1. Fields work as expected. The Eligible to Sign field and Meets Age Requirements will display the signing date that the player turned 16. It will not show the next signing period's date
2. Profile loads in view mode. Notification that profile has been saved.

If Grandfathered player is 24 years old or older, he will not display in quicksearch.

4. Quicksearch and Advance Search for Grandfathered player Open Profile
5. Login as adam.cali@mlb.com/Baseball14
6. Quicksearch and Advance Search for Grandfathered player Open Profile
7. Login as dan.dixon@mlb.com/Baseball14
8. Quicksearch and Advance Search for Grandfathered player Open Profile
custom_expected:
1. Home dashboard displays 
2. Grandfathered player appears in search results. User can view player profile.
3. Home dashboard displays 
4. Grandfathered player appears in search results. User can view player profile.
5. Home dashboard displays 
6. Grandfathered player appears in search results. User can view player profile.
7. Home dashboard displays 
8. Grandfathered player appears in search results. User can view player profile.

title: Create L1 Player
custom_steps:
1. On Create New widget select International Amateur Player from Dropdown
2. Fill in all required fields 
3. Enter a DOB 9/1/1995 or After 
4. Click 'Register'
custom_expected:
1. International Fields display 
2. Fields work as expected 
3. A message should appear over Birth Date field to say that “Subject to L1”. The Next button should change to “Register”
4. International Amateur Player profile should be displayed in edit mode. Data from the widget should have been populated in to the profile.

title: Hospital of Birth Field appears for Australia
custom_steps:
1. Create L1 player from Australia click Register
2. 'Hospital of Birth' field should be present in Bio Information Section
custom_expected:
1. Fields work as expected 
2. Hospital of Birth' field text box should be available for Country Australia only. Field should be editable

title: Residency Review Questions
custom_preconds:
Log in as BOC 
User Enters info for L1 player into Create New and has clicked Register
custom_steps:
1. Following question appears in Bio Section, "Has the player ever been to Canada or any of the 50 states of the USA, the District of Columbia(Washington,DC), Puerto Rico , or any other Commonwealth Territory or Possession of the United States of America?"
2. Select Yes
3. Enter text into Residency review questions 
4. Click Register
custom_expected:
1. User can toggle between radio buttons
2. More questions appear: 
- How many times has the player been to any of the above locations? 
- How long was the player's longest stay in any of the above locations? 
- Residency follow up needed ? (Radio)
- Please provide the date of the last stay and any additional relevant information that the player provided concerning the above questions
3. User enters text 
4. User receives error message that only numeric values are accepted.

title: Add Action Button
custom_steps:
1. Click Add on National ID section
2. Click Trash Can next to additional National ID
3. Click Add on Player's Address Section
4. Click Trash can next to additional address
5. Click add on Player's Phone Section
6. Click Trash can on additional phone
7. Click Add on Player's Email section
8. Click Trash Can next to additional email
custom_expected:
1. Additional fields present 
2. Additional fields deleted 
3. Additional fields present 
4. Additional fields deleted 
5. Additional fields present 
6. Additional fields deleted 
7. Additional fields present 
8. Additional fields deleted

title: Make an address the Same a Birth Address
custom_steps: 1. Click Make Same as Birth Address in Address(es) Section
custom_expected: 1. The Country, Birth Province (State, Territory etc.), and Birth City should be completed with same information as the Bio Section

title: Create New Trainer
custom_preconds:
Log in as BOC account 
User is creating a player and is on Intl Player profile in edit mode
custom_steps:
1. Click New Trainer button in Trainer/Agent Section 
2. Fill out required fields and phone number and email 
3. Click Save 
4. Return to Player Profile Tab
custom_expected:
1. New Tab opens with blank trainer/agent profile 
2. Fields work as expected 
3. Trainer/agent profile loads to view mode. Profile has a status of Approved 
4. Trainer/Agent info is populated into the player profile

title: Make Phone and Email Same as Trainer
custom_steps:
1. Locate Phone Number Section 
2. Click Make Same as Trainer Button 
3. Locate Email Address(es) Section 
4. Click Make Same as Trainer Button
custom_expected:
1. Fields are displayed 
2. Type switches to Trainer/Agent and phone number details of trainer populate into the phone number field 
3. Fields are displayed 
4. Type switches to Trainer/Agent and email details of trainer populate into the email field

title: Upload and delete files
custom_steps:
1. Click Add File button 
2. Select File to upload 
3. Click Trash Can
4. Click Yes on "Are you sure?" prompt 
5. Repeat steps 1 and 2 
6. Attach labels
custom_expected:
1. Pop up displays showing files on computer to select 
2. File is uploaded to section 
3. "Are you sure?" prompt displays telling that file will be permanently deleted 
4. File is deleted 
5. Results of step 1 and 2 
6. Labels are successfully attached. User can add more than one label to a file

title: Make sure comments are attached
custom_steps:
1. Add a comments to the uploaded file
2. Click Save
3. Hover over Comment Icon
custom_expected:
1. Clicking the comments icon should display a popup window for user to enter comments
2. Clicking save should attach the comment to the file
3. Hovering over comments icon should display a pop up with the comment

title: Verify that registraton players are successfully created
custom_steps:
1. Verify profile page
2. Fill in all required fields for profile, including uploading required files
3. Enter a valid email address for player (use your email)
4. Click Register
custom_expected:
1. Following sections should be displayed:
- Bio Information
- National Identification Number(s)
- Trainer/Agent/League Information
- Player’s Phone Number(s)
- Player’s Email Addresses
- Attached Files
2. Fields work as expected 
3. Email will be needed for later test
4.  Profile should be successfully saved. The profile should be L1 registered with Registration Status of Pending review BOC

title: Verify player is added to Club Registration List and Registration Admin
custom_preconds:
[C54070]

BOC user has just registered player
custom_steps:
1. Locate Club Registration Widget 
2. Filter for player that was registered 
3. Locate Reg Admin Widget 
4. Filter for player that was registered
custom_expected:
1. Widget displays with list of player that are on club's registration list 
2. Player appears in widget
3. Widget displays with list of players that have been registered by any user 
4. Player appears in widget

title: Verify BOC can update profile
custom_steps:
1. Locate Registration Admin Widget
2. Find player and open profile
3. Click Edit
custom_expected:
1. All registered players display in widget 
2. Profile displays in view mode
3. Profile reloads to edit mode and All fields except for Meets Age Requirement, Birth Country(in the top-most section of the profile), Level 1 Registered, Level 2 Registered, Registration Status, Player ID#, and Verified By should be editable.

title: Verify BOC can delete profile
custom_steps:
1. Locate Registration Admin Widget
2. Find player and open profile
3. Click Delete
4. Click Yes
5. Click Delete
custom_expected:
1. Widget displays with list of players registered 
2. Profile loads in view mode 
3. A confirmation message will pop-up asking if you'd like to delete the profile (Yes/No)
4. A second confirmation message will pop-up asking if you're sure you'd like to delete the profile
5. A notification should appear that the player has been removed. User is returned to home dashboard

title: Verify player is added to Club Registration List
custom_steps:
1. Locate Club Registration Widget 
2. Filter for player that was registered
custom_expected:
1. Widget displays with list of player that are on club's registration list 
2. Player appears in widget

title: Verify I can update certain sections
custom_steps:
1. Locate Club Registration List Widget
2. Find player and open profile
3. Click Edit
custom_expected:
1. Displays list of players that the club has registered 
2. Profile opens in view mode 
3. Profile reloads to edit mode. Fields in Header, Bio Information, and National Identicaton Number(s) section should not be editable. Rest of fields below National Identification Number(s) should be editable

title: Verify he is eligible to sign at 16 during the signing period
custom_steps:
1. Create a Level 1 Registration player that is currently 14 years old with a birthdate of January 1 and click Register 
2. Locate Eligible to Sign Date and Meets age requirement dates in header
custom_expected:
1. Fields work as expected and Intl player profile loads in edit mode
2. Verify that the player's Eligible to Sign Date is July 2nd AFTER the player's 16th birthday. Verify that the players Meets Age requirement date is equal to the Eligible to Sign Date.

title: Verify he is eligible to sign at 16 on the correct date
custom_steps:
1. Create a Level 1 Registration player that will turn 16 during the next signing period. Make the player's birthday July 13. Click Register
2. Locate Eligible to sign and Meets age Requirements Date
custom_expected:
1. Fields work as expected and profile loads in edit mode 
2. Verify that the player's Eligible to Sign Date is the player's 16th birthday. It will not say 7/2. The date will be 7/13 the day the player actually turned 16. Verify that the players Meets Age requirement date is equal to the Eligible to Sign Date.

title: Verify Eligible to Sign and Meets Age Requirements Dates are calculated correctly
custom_steps:
1. Create a Level 1 Registration player that is currently 17 years old with a birthdate of January 1. Click Register 
2. View Eligible to Sign and Meets age requirements dates
custom_expected:
1. Fields work as expected and Intl Player Profile loads in Edit mode 
2. Verify that the players Eligible to Sign Date is the next July 2nd. (ex: If creating the profile in October 2015, next July 2nd would be July 2nd 2016)Verify that the players Meets Age requirement date is July 2nd of the year of the player's 16th birthday aka would be the year before if the player is 17

title: Verify Eligible to Sign and Meets Age Requirements Dates are calculated correctly
custom_steps:
1. Create a Level 1 Registration player that is currently 17 years old with a birthdate of August 1. Click Register 
2. View Eligible to Sign and Meets Age requirement dates
custom_expected:
1. Fields work as expected and Intl Player Profile loads to view mode 
2. Verify that the players Eligible to Sign Date is the next July 2nd. (ex: If creating the profile in October 2014, next July 2nd would be July 2nd 2015) Verify that the players Meets Age requirement date is the player's actual 16th birthday aka would be August 1 of the previous year

title: Only BOC can edit Player's whose passed their Eligible to Sign Date
custom_steps:
1. Open a player's profile whose Eligible to Sign Date has passed 
2. Click Edit 
3. Log in as BOC 
4. Open a player's profile whose Eligible to Sign Date has passed 
5. Click Edit 
6. Click override on warning message 
7. Make changes and click save
custom_expected:
1. Profile opens in view mode 
2. Error message displays: Error
The player you are attempting to edit has passed their Eligible to Sign Date. Please use ebis1 to make any updates to this player's profile.
3. Dashboard displays 
4. Profile opens in view mode
5. Warning message displays: "Warning
This player has passed their Eligible to Sign Date. Please ensure that any edits you make here are also reflected in ebis1."
6. Profile reloads to edit mode 
7. User able to make changes. Profile reloads to view mode. Save is successful

title: Run All Registered Players report
BOC can only Create and See Hidden Profile
custom_steps:
1. Select International Amateur Player from Dropdown on Create New Widget
2. Fill in all required fields 
Note: DOB must be BEFORE 9/1/1995
3. Check “Hidden Player” checkbox 
4. Click “Next”
5. Fill in all required fields 
6. Click “Save” 
7. Login as a Club and search for the player
8. Login as MLSB User and search for the player
custom_expected:
1. Create new widget displays Intl fields
2. "Hidden Profile" checkbox appears when DOB entered is BEFORE 9/1/1995
3. Check box works as expected 
4. Data from widget should be populated into profile. 
5. Fields work as expected 
6. User receives notification that profile is successfully saved. At the top of the profile under the player's name it will say (Hidden Profile) 
7. Clubs should not see profile
8. MLSB should not see profile

title: Verify Hidden Player information in Widget
custom_steps:
1. Locate Hidden Player Widget
2. Filter for player on widget
custom_expected:
1. Widget displays list of hidden profiles 
2. Hidden player created should appear in widget

title: Reveal a player to users
custom_steps:
1. Locate Hidden Players widget 
2. Click reveal button for a player on the widget
custom_expected:
1. Hidden Players widget should be displayed
2. Player should be removed from the Hidden Player widget.

title: Verify that the revealed player can be found via search.
custom_steps:
1. Log in as Club user
2. Use Quicksearch to search for the player revealed in [C54123] (Player must be younger than 23 to appear in QuickSearch)
3. Use Advanced Search to search for the player identified in Step 2.
4. Log in as MLSB user
5. Use Quicksearch to search for the player revealed in [C54123] (Player must be younger than 23 to appear here)
6. Use Advanced Search to search for the player identified in Step 2
custom_expected:
1. Dashboard displays
2. The player appears in Quicksearch results.
3. The player appears in Advanced Search results.
4. Dashboard displays
5. The player appears in Quicksearch results.
6. The player appears in Advanced Search results.

title: Ensure the club match appears in the Hidden Players widget
custom_steps:
1. Log in as BOC and Copy the info down of a player in the Hidden Players widget (will need info for following steps) 
2. Log in as Club user
3. Create a new player profile with the same National ID (if present), DOB and Last Name as the existing hidden profile, and at least 2 of the following: First Name, Birth City, Twin Count, as the hidden player. Click Next
4. Complete profile and click Save
5. Log in as BOC
6. On the Hidden Players widget, find the hidden profile identified in step 1. 
7. Click the + icon Ensure the player profile created in step 3 appears as a match for the hidden profile.
custom_expected:
1. User able to view hidden players. 
2. Dashboard displays 
3. No match message appears since user does not have permission to view hidden player profile 
4. No match message appears, club created profile is saved successfully
5. Dashboard displays 
6. There should be a + icon in the Match column. 
7. Clicking it expands the view to show the matching players. A Merge option is available for these profiles.

title: Ensure the MLSB match appears in the Hidden Players widget
custom_steps:
1. Log in as BOC and Copy the info down of a player in the Hidden Players widget (will need info for following steps) 
2. Log in as MLSB Admin user
3. Create a new player profile with the same National ID (if present), DOB and Last Name as the existing hidden profile, and at least 2 of the following: First Name, Birth City, Twin Count, as the hidden player. Click Next
4. Complete profile and click Save
5. Log in as BOC
6. On the Hidden Players widget, find the hidden profile identified in step 1. 
7. Click the + icon Ensure the player profile created in step 3 appears as a match for the hidden profile.
custom_expected:
1. User able to view hidden players. 
2. Dashboard displays 
3. No match message appears since user does not have permission to view hidden player profile 
4. No match message appears, MLSB created profile is saved successfully
5. Dashboard displays 
6. There should be a + icon in the Match column. 
7. Clicking it expands the view to show the matching players. A Merge option is available for these profiles.

title: Combine matched profiles into one.
custom_steps:
1. Locate the matched profiles created in [C54125]
2. Click Merge on one of the matched profiles.
3. Click Cancel on confirmation prompt.
4. Click Merge on one of the matched profiles again.
5. Click Merge on confirmation prompt.
6. Verify that the player no longer appears on the Hidden Player widget.
7. Search for the merged player and verify that the profile was merged.
8. Login as a Club or MLSB user and advanced search for the player.
custom_expected:
1. Match appears 
2. A confirmation prompt appears.
3. Confirmation prompt is closed, merge is not performed.
4. Confirmation prompt appears again.
5. The profiles are successfully merged into one.
6. Player should no longer appear in the widget.
7. Verify that the merged profile shows the information from the NON-hidden profile. 
8. Verify that the merged player can be found via search.

title: Keep the profiles separate
custom_steps:
1. Locate a hidden profile with a match in the Hidden Players widget, or create the scenario by running Hidden_Profile_005
2. Click Do Not Merge.
3. Click Cancel
4. Click Do Not Merge again.
5. Click OK
custom_expected:
2. A prompt is shown, asking the user to confirm that the player is not a match.
3. The prompt is dismissed; the player is not merged, and is not removed from the widget.
4. The prompt appears again.
5. The prompt is dismissed. The players are not merged, and the match no longer appears in the Hidden Players widget.

title: Set First Review to Pre-Verified
custom_steps:
1. Open player profile from Reg admin whose registration status is Pending BOC Review 
2. Click Edit 
3. Set First Review to Pre-Verified and click save
custom_expected:
1. Profile loads in view mode 
2. Profile reloads to edit mode 
3. User sets first review to Pre-verified. Profile loads to view mode and Registration status now says Pre-Verified.

title: Add player to Club Registration
custom_steps:
1. Log in as club
2. In the Create New widget select International Amateur Player
3. Enter information EXACTLY as appears player that was pre-verified in [C59478]
4. Click Register
5. Select Existing Player
6. Click 'Add To Club Reg List'
7. Add Contact Information and Attached Files
8. Click Save
custom_expected:
1. Dashboard loads 
2. International Fields appear 
3. Fields work as expected 
4. Match message appears with matching profile. User can toggle between the match profile and the one that they are creating 
5. Verify 'Add To Club Reg List' button become active
6. Matching registration profile loads in edit mode. Contact information is blank for user to fill out. User will not see other users contact info 
7. Fields work as expected 
8. Profile reloads to view mode

title: Ensure that Player added to reg list appears in widget and in search

2. Filter for player that was added to the club reg list in [C54129]
3. Quicksearch for same player from step 2 
4. Advance search for same player from step 2
custom_expected:
1. Widget displays list of players club has registered 
2. Player appears in widget 
3. Player appears in quicksearch 
4. Player appears in advance search

custom_steps:
1. Locate Trainers/Agents Widget 
2. Click Create New 
3. Click Save
custom_expected:
1. Widget displays list of approved trainers/agents
2. Blank Trainer/Agent profile loads 
3. Error message displays that First Name, Last Name, Country, and City are required. Fields will be highlighted in red

title: Create new Trainer/Agent
custom_steps:
1. Fill out required fields on Trainer/Agent profile and complete phone number and email sections
2. Click Save 
3. Click Close on profile 
4. Filter for Trainer/Agent created in Trainers/Agents widget
custom_expected:
1. Fields work as expected 
2. Trainer/Agent profile loads to view mode. Profile status is approved 
3. User is returned to home dashboard
4. Trainer appears in widget

title: BOC can edit Trainer/Agent through Registration Profiles
custom_steps:
1. Enter info on Create new Widget to create an L1 reg player and click Register 
2. In Trainer/Agent section, enter the name of an approved Trainer that you created in [C59483] and select it from drop down 
3. Click the Edit Details button in the section header
4. Update information
5. Click Save
6. Return to player profile
7. Complete rest of required fields on player profile and click register
custom_expected:
1. Fields work as expected and Intl player profile loads in edit mode
2. Trainer info populates in phone number and email fields 
3. Trainer/agent profile that was selected on player profile opens in new tab in edit mode
4. Fields work as expected 
5. Changes should be saved and trariner/agent profile should reload in View mode- Status of trainer profile is approved
6. Updates should be reflected in the player profile.
7. Player is successfully registered

title: Search for Trainer/Agent that was edited
custom_steps:
1. Click Search on left navigation 
2. Search for International Trainer 
3. Filter for "Last Name" "Equals" and type in the last name of the trainer you created and edited in [C59483] and [C54132] respectively 
4. Click Search 
5. Open Trainer/Agent profile and view details
custom_expected:
1. Advance search opens 
2. User able to select International Trainer from dropdown
3. Dropdowns and Fields work as expected
4. Search results display 
5. Trainer/Agent profile loads in view mode. Edits that were made in [C54132] are displayed

title: Verify that BOC is allowed to delete any Trainer/Agent
custom_steps:
1. Locate the Trainer/Agent widget
2. Click on a Trainer/Agent
3. Click "Delete"
4. Click "Back"
5. Click "Delete" 
6. Click "Yes"
custom_expected:
1. Widget displays list of approved trainers 
2. Trainer/Agent profile should be loaded in View mode. 
3. A blocker message should be displayed “Are you sure” with “Yes” and “Back” buttons
4. User taken back to Trainer/Agent profile
5. A blocker message should be displayed “Are you sure” with “Yes” and “Back” buttons
6. A Notification should be displayed to user “Trainer/Agent has been successfully deleted” and user is returned to home dashboard

title: Verification email is sent to player-English
custom_steps:
1. Open email account that was linked to player 
2. View email
custom_expected:
1. Email should be send to the player

With the following content:

Content of the mail should be

Subject: fullPlayerName - Level 1 Registration Confirmation - yearShort

This email is to notify you that the player listed below has been Level 1 registered for the yrShort Signing Period (yrLong). 
Level 1 registration is a prerequisite for the potential signing of a First-Year Minor League Uniform Player Contract by any international player born on 
or after September 1, 1995.

All registered players are subject to a residency review for purposes of confirming ineligibility for the First-Year Player Draft.

Last Name: lastName
Extended Last Name: extendedLastName
First Name: firstName
Middle Name: middleName
Birth Date: birthDate
Registration ID Number: playerId

*Verify Spanish version of the email is not included

title: Verification email- Spanish
custom_preconds:
Login as BOC
[C54158]
Player address must be from one of the following countries: 
·         Dominican Republic
·         Venezuela
·         Panama
·         Colombia
·         Mexico
·         Nicaragua
·         Argentina
·         Spain
·         Costa Rica
·         Ecuador
·         El Salvador
·         Guatemala
·         Honduras
·         Peru
custom_steps:
1. Open Email linked to player whose status was set to Verified 
2. View email
custom_expected:
1. Email should be send to the player:

2. Email should display the following contents: (Spanish First, then English version)  

Subject: fullPlayerName - Nivel 1 Registro Confirmación - yearShort

Este correo electrónico es para notificarle que el jugador enumerado a continuación ha sido registrado Nivel 1 para el período de firma yrShort-Spanish (yrLong-Spanish). Registro Nivel 1 es un requisito previo para la potencial firma de un Contrato Uniforme de Jugador de Primer Año de Ligas Menores por cualquier jugador internacional nacido en o después del 1 de septiembre 1995.

Todos los jugadores inscritos están sujetos a una revisión de residencia para fines de confirmar la inhabilitación para el Draft de Primer Año.

Apellido: lastName
Segundo apellido: extendedLastName
Nombre: firstName
Segundo nombre: middleName
Fecha de Nacimiento: birthDate(Spanish)
Numero de identificación del registro: playerId



Subject: fullPlayerName - Level 1 Registration Confirmation - yearShort

This email is to notify you that the player listed below has been Level 1 registered for the yrShort Signing Period (yrLong). Level 1 registration 
is a prerequisite for the potential signing of a First-Year Minor League Uniform Player Contract by any international player born on or after September 1, 1995.

All registered players are subject to a residency review for purposes of confirming ineligibility for the First-Year Player Draft.

Last Name: lastName
Extended Last Name: extendedLastName
First Name: firstName
Middle Name: middleName
Birth Date: birthDate
Registration ID Number: playerId

9. Player appears in "L2 Registration List" widget

title: Create two Registration Profiles
custom_steps:
1. Successfully register an L1 Player (Birthday on or after 9/1/1995) Fill out all contact info and attachments 
2. Log in as different club 
3. Register an L1 player with the exact Bio information as the player in Step 1. Fill out different contact info and attachments than Club 1.
custom_expected:
1. Player is successfully registered 
2. Dashboard displays 
3. Player is successfully registered

title: Merge all information into one profile
custom_preconds:
[C59690]
Login as BOC
1. Locate Reg admin widget
custom_steps:
1. Filter for profiles created in [C59690]
2. Click the checkbox next to their names
3. Click “Merge”
custom_expected:
1. Both profiles appear in Reg admin widget 
2. Check boxes become checked 
3. Merge prompt displays following in table format:
- List of selected players
-Bio Info Radio Button (for each profile)
- Birth Cert. Radio Button (for each profile)
- Consent Form Radio Button (for each profile)
- Contact Info Radio Button (for each profile)
- Merge button
- Cancel button

User can toggle between both profiles to select which will become the MASTER

title: Cancel Merge process
custom_steps: 1. Click “Cancel"
custom_expected: 1. Merge window should be dismissed and the profiles remain as they were

title: Merge profile
custom_steps:
1. Select which Bio, Contact Info and any attached files you would like as "Master"
2. Click Merge
3. Click Merge on confirmation message
4. Open player profile and verify which information is displayed as master
5. Check L1 Registered Date and L2 Registered (if applicable)
6. Toggle between origin to make sure each org's contact information correctly displays
custom_expected:
1. User is able to select different 'Master' information from each profile. Only one of each section can be selected
2. User receives confirmation asking if the user is sure they want to merge the two profiles
3. Notification that merge was successful. Only one of the profiles is in the Reg Admin widget 
4. Profile opens in view mode. Info that was selected as master displays to the user 
5. L1 Registered date is the EARLIEST date the player was registered regardless of which profile information was selected as 'Master' L2 registration or Elevated details are maintained after Merge regardless of which profile information was selected as 'Master'. (if applicable)
6. User is able to see the different org's contact information and attachments

title: Check correct "Master" information is set in profile
custom_preconds:
[C54179]
Login as Club whose BIO info was NOT selected as MASTER in [C54179]
custom_steps:
1. Search and Open merged player profile from [C54179]
2. View Bio Information 
3. View Contact information and attached files
custom_expected:
1. Profile displays in view mode 
2. Selected 'Master' Bio Information is visible
3. Club should only see the Contact Information they submitted. They SHOULD NOT see contact information submitted by another CLUB, regardless of what was set as Master. Club should only see the Attached Files they submitted. They SHOULD NOT see Files submitted by another CLUB, regardless of what was set as 'Master'.

title: L2 information Remains
custom_preconds:
- Log in as BOC
- One of the profiles to merge has been L2 registered 
- Locate Reg Admin Widget
custom_steps:
1. Check checkbox of two profiles (one of the profiles should have been L2 registered) 
2. Click Merge
3. Select the NON- L2 registered profile to be the Master for Bio 
4. Click Merge 
5. Click Merge 
6. Open Merged profile and view L2 registered
custom_expected:
1. Boxes are checked 
2. Merge window displays
3. User able to select which will be master 
4. Systems displays warning message asking if user is sure they want to merge the two profiles
5. Notification displays that merge is successful. Reg admin widget refreshes to display merge 
6. Regardless of which profile is selected for master, the L2 information will always display in the the merged profile

title: Merge through profile
custom_preconds:
Have BOC register a profile 
Have club user register a profile with different last name but all information is the same
custom_steps:
1. Log in as BOC user 
2. Open registration profile BOC created in preconditions 
3. Edit last name to match last name of club created profile 
4. Click save 
5. Click Merge 
6. Select Master and click merge
7. View merged profile
custom_expected:
1. Dashboard displays 
2. Views Intl Profile 
3. Able to edit last name 
4. Match message appears to club profile with Merge and Register button 
5. Both profiles appear in window to select master 
6. Able to toggle between which is master and merge 
7. Profile is successfully merged

title: Review, Edit, and add/view files for the BOC
custom_steps:
1.Go to System Admin on the Left Nav
2. Select Add New button
3. Select Form(s)
4. Add files to create new forms.
5. Select Category, Form Type, Language, Country/Region for each file.
6. Check or uncheck the Active box in order to make forms active/inactive.
7. Click Submit.
custom_expected:
If a form is created for multiple countries then an Orange icon appears in the Country/Region column of the widget.

User can add an Active System Form 

User can add an Inactive System Form

User can filter, make comments, and edit a System Form

User can view a System Form

title: View only active System Forms
custom_steps:
1 Go to Reporting on the Left Nav
2. Click on Forms Tab
3. Open active system forms
custom_expected:
Should see only active System Forms from the BOC

User can filter System Forms

User can open System Forms

title: Club user downloads template
custom_steps:
1. User clicks Upload List on "Club Registration List" widget 
2. User clicks Download Template
custom_expected:
1. Pop up message displays, user can upload spreadsheet or download template 
2. The system downloads an excel spreadsheet template for use in multiple player submission to the user's computer.

title: Club User uploads list
custom_steps:
1. User clicks Upload list on "Club registration list" 
2. User selects file and clicks upload
custom_expected:
1. Pop up message displays, user can upload spreadsheet or download template
2. System processes the submitted file. System adds to the Org's Club Registration List (tags) each player that appears in the spreadsheet AND has been registered and has been at least Pre-Verified. (Same rules as via Create New - see specific rules here). System creates a results spreadsheet that is available for download via the Notifications widget that has a results column that specifies whether a player is "Registered" or "Not Yet Registered".

title: Download results spreadsheet
custom_steps:
1. CLUB user navigates to notifications widget 
2. User downloads results spreadsheet
custom_expected:
1. Notifications widget is visible to user 
2. Spreadsheet contains results column that specifies whether a player is "Registered" or "Not Yet Registered".

title: Verify that NOT YET REGISTERED player does not display on club reg list
custom_preconds: CLUB has uploaded a spread sheet and has downloaded the results spreadsheet from the notifications widget
custom_steps:
1. Locate player on results spreadsheet that is marked "Not Yet Registered" 
2. Filter for player on club registration list widget
custom_expected:
1. Player that is not in the system or has not been registered will be marked "Not Yet Registered" 
2. Player will not appear on widget

title: Spreadsheet players
custom_steps: ![](index.php?/attachments/get/1742)

title: User sees static header and bio info section on Int'l amateur profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to an International Amateur profile for a player
custom_expected:
THEN each international amateur profile should have a Static header and a Bio info section that displays on the Info tab of a player's Profile
AND static header should match the layout of the wireframe and data discovery
AND header should include Scouting Information section 
AND info should match what was entered on the 2.0 profile

title: User views National ID number(s) on Int'l amateur profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user views an International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN profile should have National Identification Number(s) section that displays on the Info tab of a player's Profile
AND National Identification Number(s) should match the layout of the wireframe and the data discovery
AND information should match what was entered on the 2.0 profile
**note:Some countries follow a National ID format. should check all different National ID formats, see attached doc on story**

title: User views contact info on Int'l amateur profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user views an International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN profile should have Contact info section that displays on the Info tab of a player's Profile
AND Contact information should match the layout of the wireframe and the data discovery
AND Contact Information should be blank (we do not need the contact information from the 2.0 International Amateur Profiles)

title: BOC user views attached files section and comments on Int'l amateur profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to an International Amateur Profile for a player
custom_expected:
THEN profile should have an Attached Files section that only BOC can see
AND Attached Files should match the layout of the wireframe and the data discovery
AND each International Amateur Profile will have a Comments section containing BOC notes that only BOC users can see
AND BOC notes should match the layout of the wireframe and the data discovery
AND BOC notes should be populated with notes that were entered in the BOC notes section on the 2.0 profile

title: BOC user can change origin on the attached files section
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user views Attached Files section on an International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN Origin dropdown of the Attached Files section should contain any Org that attached files for that International Amateur Player
AND if an Org did not attach a file to the players profile then they should NOT appear in the dropdown
AND if the profile was merged in 2.0 then a Master option should appear in the dropdown
AND when the user selects an Origin, then the user should only see the attached files that the org uploaded

title: View an Int'l Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to an International Grandfathered Profile
custom_expected:
THEN profile should match the layout of the wireframe and data discovery
AND only BOC users should see the Attached Files and Comments sections
AND contact information that was entered on a grandfathered profile in ebis 2 should appear on the grandfathered profile in ebis 2.5
AND layout of the contact information should match the wireframe
(Note that some fields that display on International Amateur profile do NOT display on International Grandfathered profile)

title: Search
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user wants to search for an International Amateur player profile
custom_steps: WHEN they click advanced search
custom_expected:
THEN all of the needed filters will be available
AND results will display
AND visibility rules are followed https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

title: Updating of International profiles to sign MNC
custom_steps:
Users with Edit permissions for MN Contracts see a Create New icon on International Amateur profiles.
Users are able to launch a new Minor Contract for the player via the Create New.
The Minor Contract workflow is able to be completed for the International Amateur profiles. This includes the information properly populating the printed MN Contract, and the contract showing up in the International Signing Bonus utility if applicable.

title: Conversion of international amateur profiles to professionals
custom_steps:
When a MNC for an International Amateur player is moved from Terms Submitted to Terms Accepted, the international player profile should be converted to a Professional profile.
All of the relevant information should be carried forward from the amateur to the professional profile.
The MLB Program Participation and other portions of the "International" tab should be appropriately populated, in addition to the Info tab.
The player should no longer be visible in International Amateur searches and widgets.
